title: Sizzling Sisig
steps: Combine pig face, vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, peppercorns, bay leaves, salt, and enough water to cover the pork in a large pot.
Bring to a boil, skimming scum from surface. Lower heat, cover, and simmer 50 minutes to 1 hour until tender.
Over hot grill, cook pork 7-10 minutes per side until crispy and charred. Alternatively, broil at 450°F (230°C) for 4-5 minutes until charred.
Cool slightly and chop meat into small pieces.
Mix chopped meat with onions, chili peppers, calamansi juice, and liquid seasoning.
Add liver spread and stir gently. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Transfer to sizzling hot plates and serve.
notes: Volume conversions: 2 lbs pig face ≈ 907g, 1 cup vinegar ≈ 240g, ¼ cup soy sauce ≈ 60g, 1 head garlic ≈ 45g, 1 tsp peppercorns ≈ 3g, 1 tbsp salt ≈ 15g, 1 large onion ≈ 200g, 6 Thai chilies ≈ 15g, ½ cup calamansi juice ≈ 120g, 1 tbsp liquid seasoning ≈ 15g, ½ cup liver spread ≈ 120g
Works as either an appetizer or main entrée
Can be served on regular plates if sizzling plates unavailable
